p: The inhibitory activity of nipa palm vinegar against pancreatic lipase is shown in Figure 2. The nipa palm vinegar inhibited pancreatic lipase activity by 9.55, 12.51, 19.65, 28.14, 50.53, and 60.22% at concentrations of 3.13, 6.25, 12.50, 25.00, 50.00, and 100.00 µL/mL, respectively. The nipa palm vinegar had an IC 50 value of 69.95 µL/mL. Orlistat served as a pancreatic lipase inhibitor control, and a concentration of 2 µg/mL reduced activity by 53.67%. These results show that the NPV showed a lipase inhibiting activity.
